intro: Orychophragmus winkleri, commonly known as the yellow star-thistle, is a flowering plant native to the western United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a star. The plant produces bright yellow flowers with a distinctive purple center, and its leaves are typically spiny and covered in fine hairs. Orychophragmus winkleri is an annual herb that thrives in disturbed soils and arid environments. Its botanical features make it both ecologically significant and a potential invasive species in certain regions.
